intro: Cuervea jamaicensis, commonly known as the Jamaican velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils. Cuervea jamaicensis is also known for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in herbal remedies.
